title: Bug: spack install's --no-cache option does not work
body:
The `spack install --no-cache` option does not work.

I confirmed the `use_cache` option is set properly when `--no-cache` is provided on the command line; however, it appears to have *no* affect on the installation.

Having this option actually work provides a quick way to reproduce fetch-related issues for packages without having mess with your mirror settings.  For example,

```console
$ spack checksum samrai@3.12.0
 ==> Found 1 version of samrai:
  
  3.12.0  https://computing.llnl.gov/projects/samrai/download/SAMRAI-v3.12.0.tar.gz

==> Something failed on https://computing.llnl.gov/projects/samrai/download/SAMRAI-v3.12.0.tar.gz, skipping.  (All fetchers failed)
==> Error: Could not fetch any versions for samrai
...
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

You should be able to reproduce the problem if any mirror with the spec cached (e.g., Spack's `spack-public` mirror).

The following is output the first time you run it in your instance (i.e., no local cache):

```console
$ spack install --no-cache samrai@3.12.0
...
==> Installing samrai-3.12.0-valqidvhtn5rbp2lrij3my46m6il6gnl
...
==> Fetching https://spack-llnl-mirror.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/_source-cache/archive/b8/b8334aa22330a7c858e09e000dfc62abbfa3c449212b4993ec3c4035bed6b832.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Applied patch /usr/WS1/dahlgren/releases/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/samrai/no-tool-build.patch
...
```

Once your local cache is populated, the output will appear as follows:
 
```console
$ spack install --no-cache samrai@3.12.0
...
==> Installing samrai-3.12.0-valqidvhtn5rbp2lrij3my46m6il6gnl
...
==> Using cached archive: /usr/WS1/dahlgren/releases/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/b8/b8334aa22330a7c858e09e000dfc62abbfa3c449212b4993ec3c4035bed6b832.tar.gz
...
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.16.2-2880-f31bc986a8
* **Python:** 3.7.2
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-broadwell
* **Concretizer:** original

### Additional information
